Description: Handle-plate of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; on top, black-figure decoration consisting of swan standing to right with head down and with added red on wing; edge of handle-plate black.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 121, pl. XXXVII, no. 341.4)
Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 340)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 229, no. 146)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.192) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4672 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
